Industry Veteran Kathy Kibby Joins IntApp
We are pleased to announce that Kathy Kibby has joined IntApp as Managing Director for the United States Northeast region.
Kathy brings 12 years of legal industry sales expertise to IntApp. Previously, she held positions with Microsystems, LexisNexis and Interface Software.
"I'm excited to welcome Kathy to the IntApp team," said Dan Tacone, President, IntApp. "Her extensive experience in the legal market will help accelerate our continued growth."
Kathy can be reached at: Kathy.Kibby@intapp.com.
ILTA 2011
We're eagerly anticipating connecting with clients, partners and prospective customers at ILTA 2011. For the seventh consecutive year, IntApp has been selected to present as part of ILTA's state-of-the-art technology showcase. Our staff and clients will also be presenting at two panels this year:
The Case for Master Data Management Mark Raabe, Director of Applications Development, Faegre & Benson - IntApp client since 2005 Thad Jampol, CTO, IntApp Shawn Samuel, Chief Architect, Hubbard One, a Thomson Reuters Business 8/24/2011 11:30 am
Data Loss Prevention: What We've Learned from WikiLeaks Pat Archbold, Head of Risk Practice, IntApp 8/25/2011 2:00 pm
Once again, we'll also be presenting product and client showcase videos on the in-room TV channels. Come visit us at Booth #514/516. If you would like to set up a meeting with one of our Managing Directors, please email Lisa.Hern@intapp.com.
IntApp Shortlisted for ILTA Innovative Vendor Award
We are pleased to announce that IntApp has been selected as one of four finalists for the ILTA 2011 Innovative Vendor Awards. For more information, visit www.iltanet.org.
Several IntApp clients have been shortlisted for awards tied to their use of IntApp products as well. Patricia Fitzpatrick, Director of Practice Management at Katten Muchin Rosenman LLP, has been shortlisted for the Risk and Records Management Award for spearheading an ongoing, five-year loss prevention initiative designed to improve firm information risk management practices. As part of this effort, she oversaw the development of enhanced email records management capabilities and the implementation of IntApp Wall Builder to manage confidentiality and ethical screens across the firm's systems.
Perry Lawrence, Senior Data Integration Architect at O'Melveny & Myers LLP, has been shortlisted for the Emerging Technologies Award for overseeing the firm's foray into Cloud-based software by successfully integrating a hosted HRIS with the firm's IT architecture using Integration Builder. The project came in at one-fourth the projected cost and provided valuable experience for future Cloud software adoption.
Connect With Peers at IntApp's Seventh Annual Wine Tasting Event
Our Seventh Annual ILTA Wine Tasting is also in the works, watch for your invitations in the mail. If you're a client that has registered to attend ILTA but (understandably) opted out of having your name distributed to vendors, we want to make sure we don't forget to invite you, so please email Lea.Simon@intapp.com.
Not @ILTA Webinar Series
Not going to ILTA this year? There's no need to miss out on the experience. We have been running the Not @ILTA Webinar Series for the past two years with great success, and we are excited to offer this webinar series again this year. Topics will cover cloud integrations, CRM integrations, a Time Builder overview and a review of Wall Builder modules for existing customers. Keep an eye on your inbox for more details or email Lea.Simon@intapp.com to make sure you're invited.
Integration Builder CIDs
The IntApp Collaborative Integration Development (CID) program is IntApp's most extensive Integration Builder implementation program. It is a solution-oriented training program in which an industry veteran and IntApp expert will work on-site to train individuals and begin work on developing Integration Builder solutions.
If you are an Integration Builder customer who is looking do more with the software, we strongly recommend a CID to get you started in the right direction. If you are interested, please contact your account manager.
